Posted By: Demonic_Math_Tutor (1/20/2011 6:52:50 AM)

posts.post_content:
I absolutely love this card, but not for what it does in games of magic. I love it for the comedy it provides the experienced magic community, and for their entertainment (and mine) here are some of the best quotes MTG newbies have to offer,  
  
"dies to removal." - CapitalR (Although he seems to like [Ur-Golem's Eye](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ur-Golem's Eye))  
  
"only 3 mana? if needs to add AT LEAST 10 mana to be of any use" - Kroen  
  
"IT'S CARD DISADVANTAGE, IT SUCKS" - MetalCrisis  
  
"Best Card Ever Next To BaneWasp Affliction" - MasterOfEtherium  
  
"Not the best card ever...that's ancestral vision...but amazing nonetheless!" - Peaceout734  
  
"O\_o The thought of being able to get my Akroma out on turn one blows my mind   
5/5   
For a card that opens doors to victory" - Eved (little closed minded...)  
  
And the best quote...  
"This is a pretty good card, but its not worth the hype. Worse than Dark Ritual because it dies to shatter." BalonyPony  
Oh and Dark Ritual dies to Negate :P
posts.html:

"O_o The thought of being able to get my Akroma out on turn one blows my mind

Posted By: kazenpaus (10/10/2012 9:09:16 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
People are either rating this 5 Stars for sheer broken power, or they're rating it much lower for 'badly Designed- ergo not fun- ergo not "good" as I define good which includes more than win-probability increase power"  
  
Actually, after looking a lot at Vintage lists, there are some cards that I would expect to see WAY more often in decklists, and yet don't have the ubiquity their reputation suggests they should. Black Lotus is just such one of these cards, and while it's \*potential\* is simply screamingly powerful, it \*looks\* like the Vintage players of today don't just slam it in lists because they own it- Oh they DO run it, a lot, but also, I've seen WINNING decklists for Vintage that use mana and do not use Black Lotus- why not then?  
  
[Chalice of the Void](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chalice of the Void) is an Anti-0 cost Hate Tech in Vintage. I don't think it's the explanation, but I mention that card more as a question than a statement- do that, Null Rod and other hate really account for anything less than 100%... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Q: What's the difference between a Black Lotus and a pile of dead babies?  
A: I don't own a Black Lotus.  
  
Q: What's the difference between a Black Lotus and a black man?  
A: When you tap a Black Lotus, you get three mana. When you tap a black man, you get shot.  
  
Q: What's the difference between Black Lotuses and fat women?  
A: I'd rather f-uck a Black Lotus.  
  
Q: What does a black scientist and a Black Lotus have in common?  
A: They are both very rare.

posts.post_content:
Imagine black lotus in a word with 0 card draw and 0 tutors. This becomes a giant 2 for 1 engine. I always get excited when someone drops a black lotus in MTG tactics, thinking 2 for 1.  
  
And I rate on balance, the Power 9 were impossible to beat unless u had the power 9. Kinda destroyed the point of this complex card game that had all these creatures and whatnot.  
  
.5/5
